inclusion.criterion: Sickle cell disease (SCD) patients who are 3-18 years old.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Clinically significant neurologic event (stroke) or any neurologic defect lasting > 24 hours and accompanied by an infarct on cerebral magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Minimum of two episodes of acute chest syndrome within the preceding 2-year period defined as new pulmonary alveolar consolidation involving at least one complete lung segment (associated with acute symptoms including fever, chest pain, tachypnea, wheezing, rales or cough that is not attributed to asthma or bronchiolitis).
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: History of 3 or more severe pain events per year in the 2 years prior to enrollment.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Availability of 10/10 genotypically HLA identical related donor.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have a Karnofsky score ≥ 50 or WHO/ECOG ≥ 2 for patients age ≥ 16, Lansky score ≥ 50 for patients age < 16.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate cardiac function: shortening fraction of > 25% or ejection fraction of > 55% by echocardiogram.
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate renal function: serum creatinine within normal limits or creatinine clearance >70 ml/min/1.73 m2.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate liver function: Total bilirubin within normal limits and AST/ALT <2.5x upper limit of normal.
inclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with symptomatic cardiac insufficiency or arrhythmia.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients with cirrhosis on liver biopsy.
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Hepatitis B, hepatitis C, or HIV seropositive patients.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: The patient has a history of severe pain events and meets the criteria for adequate renal function. However, they have symptomatic cardiac insufficiency, which is an exclusion criterion.
